In a moment of command-blindness today, I managed to delete my entire repo of developing projects. No harm, of course - they were all git repos, and backed up on the internet. Simple matter of going to BitBucket and re-cloning, right? So first things first - grab my last project, re-clone it, get back to working in no time. Except when I tried to re-compile, it failed. At 5%. Looking like this.

How the hell was I not finding ‘OpenGL/gl.h’? I still don’t know quite what I did, but it only took 20 minutes for me to go from rendering collision-detecting dogs to not being able to compile squat.

Two hours, a half dozen fix attempts, and many StackOverflow tabs later, I get to this: Missing OpenGL Headers on Mac, which linked to yet another StackOverflow question … It turns out that even if you have Xcode installed, Command Line Tools doesn’t come with it anymore. Which means the headers I was looking for didn’t even exist at this point. Bully.

At least the fix was easy. A TLDR: Run “xcode-select –install”.

And now we’re all back up and running! How did I somehow remove my Command Line Tools and OpenGL headers? Still no idea. Tips for future me, dealing with weird compile failures:

  1. Keep scrolling. If you’re lucky, someone else who had the same problem has commented recently on that 6-year-old thread with an updated answer.
  2. Version control might not keep everything perfect, but it’ll get you back to working without weeks of sleepless nights.
  3. OS’s do some pretty weird things.
